intro: Chytraculia punctata, commonly known as the punctate chytracul, is a rare and unique species belonging to the family Chytraculaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring small, punctuated markings along the veins. The plant exhibits a short growth cycle, typically flowering and setting seed within a single growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
